comments:
This bug originates from my thread on the eclipse.birt newsgroup.

I have configured the Birt RunAndRenderTask to use FORenderOption options with
the TailoredForFOP option set to true.  Using the generated .fo file
(TestReport.fo in the example below), I try to convert it to a PDF using FOP
v0.20.5 from command line.  The errors below occur.

I then hand-modified the .fo file to remove the "text-transform",
"word-spacing", and "letter spacing" tags from the file, which removed
the first 6 errors.  The ClassCastException remains.

Help?

D:\FOP\fop-0.20.5>fop.bat -fo TestReport.fo -print -d

[DEBUG] FO
[DEBUG] fo input file: TestReport.fo

Created an attachment (id=24450)
Test report design

Created an attachment (id=24451)
The imcompatible .fo file generated by BIRT

Created an attachment (id=24452)
The test program used to create the .fo file

To execute the test program (assuming BIRT_HOME resides in d:\tools\birt\lib):

java -DRUN_UNDER_ECLIPSE=false -DBIRT_HOME=d:\tools\birt\lib RunReport
TestReport.rptdesign -f

Thsiis only tentatively scheduled for 1.0.1. If the investigation from 
developer reveals that the problem can not be fixed quickly, it has to be 
addressed in release 2.0.

when you use the option RenderOptionBase.OUTPUT_FORMAT_FO, the fo file you got 
conforms to the XSL-FO spec indeed. However, that fo file included some 
elements which FOP cannot process. For instance, FOP cannot process the 
element fo:block-container. You can visit http://xml.apache.org/fop to see the 
FOP's compliance. Why can you get a PDF with the option 
RenderOptionBase.OUTPUT_FORMAT_PDF? The reason is that we try our best to find 
an alternative element for that element which FOP cannot process.

This issue is not resolved.

What is the purpose of having the TailoredForFOP option in the FORenderOption
class if it doesn't isn't going to support FOP?

TailoredForFOP option did not take effect when output FO. Add TailoredForFOP
support by splitting FOPReportEmitter into FOPReportEmitter and PDFReportEmitter.
